intro: Brassica brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-seed mustard, is a flowering plant in the mustard family, Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant produces small, round seeds that are typically less than 2 millimeters in diameter. Native to regions of Europe and western Asia, it thrives in dry, disturbed soils and can often be found along roadsides and in meadows. Due to its compact size and unique seed structure, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists studying plant adaptation and diversity.
